newsitem.title: USA: Matrix names officer, settles suit.
newsitem.headline: Matrix names officer, settles suit.

text.p: Matrix Pharmaceutical Inc said Friday it has settled a lawsuit with Collagen Corp which had been pending since 1994.

Matrix said in a statement it has agreed not to make or sell products for five years that are directly competitive with Collagen's current core products. Collagen has granted Matrix a nonexclusive license to certain Collagen intellectual property, for certain non-monetary consideration. The lawsuit is being dismissed with prejudice, it said.

The company also said it appointed James Glynn to the new position of chief operating officer and chief financial officer. President and Chief Executive Officer Craig McMullen said he plans to resign for personal reasons but will remain in his current position for a limited time while a search is conducted for a successor.

The now-settled lawsuit involved Collagen's claims of trade secret misappropriation against Matrix and two former Collagen employees hired by Matrix in 1992, as well as cross-complaints against Collagen by Matrix and the two employees for alleged defamation and violations of state law unfair competition.
